revised_title: Anatomical Observations on Venomous Snakes and Their Unique Structures
tldr: The article discusses observations on the orifices found in certain venomous snakes, specifically those situated between the nostril and the eye. The author, Patrick Russell, and Everard Home provide detailed descriptions of the structure of these orifices and a bag connected to the eye found in the same snakes. They also describe the function of these structures and their role in the snake's anatomy.
